channel.title: Css help
channel.description: If you look [url=http://www.hastingsunlimited.net]here[/url] and scroll down to the footer you will see the weather div in the wrong spot. I was trying to get it next to the "do you remember" but after I placed the "well" class around everything it decided it wanted to move on me. I tried float:right thinking that may help but I can't seem the accomplish this. I would appreciate any help at all. Thanks

item.title: Css help
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:4, topic:506752”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=624987.msg4255461#msg4255461 date=1362678370]
Oh and what the heck is up with that slider
[/quote]
yea it was a free dl that I’ve been adding/editing.

lololol you like those images ;)[/quote]
They burn my eyes. Oh and forgot to say that you’ve also got to place the weather div above the lead-well in the HTML.

Read full topic

item.title: Css help
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Weather div is a child of span8, parent has width of 770px and is not enough to occupy the weather div. Just increase the width of span8

ps. is this some sort of framework?

Read full topic

I was trying to get it next to the “do you remember” but after I placed the “well” class around everything it decided it wanted to move on me.
